otters.vis package#

Submodules#

otters.vis.graph module#

class otters.vis.graph.Graph(df=Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], plot=True, **kwargs)#

Bases: object

show()#
class otters.vis.graph.Plot(parent)#

Bases: Graph

addAreaLines(cols=[], stack_group='one', level=-1, **kwargs)#
addLines(cols=[], level=-1, **kwargs)#
addScatter(x, y, **kwargs)#

You’re gonna need to add an x and y. You should be able to add 2 Ys, and so those are a list. With the Xs idk suck a lemon.

boundYAxis()#

Should be replaced by the folloifing: self.fig.update_yaxes(autorange=”max”, autorangeoptions_include=0)

Bounds the range of each y axis to the traces currently present on the plot This is way too complicated, but I need to move on

createPlot(fig=None)#

Creates a plot in the EPS style. Most of this crap is formatting We add here the trendline(s), the legend, x/y axes.

createTimeline(df)#

Creates a standalone timeline from a supplied events DataFrame

Paramaters: df: DataFrame, Required > Should be format: [‘Timsetamp’, ‘Name’]. It only takes the first 2 columns so you can put like a description or whatever after. Eventually a description will be rolled into hover text
